condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and other national partners have increased capacity at national and subnational levels for improved implementation, monitoring and inclusive sector planning

description.narrative: UNICEF has supported the Ministry of General Education and Instruction to strengthen partnerships at national and subnational level, leading to improved programme interventions, monitoring and inclusive sector planning. A Joint Education Sector Review, teacher capacity development, and distribution of South Sudan school textbooks all support quality education provision. To strengthen the evidence and advocacy base, Education Management Information System data is now available, a national level Annual Education Census has been established, a pilot mapping of Out-Of-School Children is complete, and the first education Budget Brief will guide budget allocations and inform planning for learning outcomes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Teachers enrolled in the continous professional development
System Strengthening - EMIS - EMIS that provides disaggregated data, including income/assets, disability and school physical environment - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - National strategies address inequities in education resource allocation - score (1-4), see guidance
Education systems are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning
